The graph shows a Ferris wheel, together with the height of a passenger as a function of time.

li.p: To start, the Ferris wheel has a radius of 10 feet, passengers board it from the ground (a height of 0 feet), and it takes 10 minutes to complete a rotation.

Use the bottom slider to increase the time, and two things will happen:
The passenger (shown by a red triangle) will move around the Ferris Wheel.
the passenger's height will be graphed as a function of time.
Next, use the slider to change the radius to 30 feet. Move the time slider and notice the change made to the graph.
Next, use the slider to move the height of the boarding platform. Move the time slider and notice the change made to the graph.
Finally, use the slider to change the period of the Ferris Wheel so it completes a revolution every 20 seconds. Move the time slider and notice the change made to the graph.
